author: @onseayu
text: Hi Alex!  Not sure if you take suggestions for videos, but I was hoping for advice on getting a data analyst role with no professional experience at all.  Because that's the position I'm in, and on top of that, no degree or relevant work history.  But I do have a portfolio, and have won multiple data challenges. I've been applying for weeks with zero responses.  Not sure where to go from here, so I'm open to any advice, on any aspect. I know it's not exactly the same situation you were in, but hopefully you have some insights you'd be able to share.  Thanks!

author: @jbpauler
text: This is a great review Alex!   Especially appreciate the feedback you provided, which I will address here:   1. Noting the additional fields as 'required' is a great suggestion, and just an oversight on our part. We will update it. Thanks for calling it out!   2. Adding additional skills / certificates that are non-Maven to that skills section is something we've talked about, but didn't make it into this MVP launch. I agree with you, opening that field up would be smart. We're still debating this one internally (what to do, how it should look, how open vs prescriptive, etc), so can't promise quick changes. But expect changes here at some point.   3. Not sure what happened with your Tableau embed attempt. At first glance, I can't see anything you did wrong. I know this is working for other folks, so need to give it a closer look. It's possible there was a bug when you were trying this (still a very new product!) or maybe I am just missing something. We have this embed guide to help folks through the different embed options:   https://help.mavenanalytics.io/en/articles/6792558-how-do-i-create-a-great-portfolio-project#h_6ed62fc1b2  Consider this product a work in progress. We love feedback like this, so keep it coming!!

author: @DJAlstein
text: Hey Alex love the review, i just noticed something maybe you would like to be improved. sometimes when you talk a bit louder the mic is clipping, one way to deal with this is to set the mic to -6 DB at its loudest when you are recording and then use a compressor later on in post production to make it louder that way its consistent, loud and clear. these are my 2 cents. love ya buddy keep being awesome
